summary: This document is a chain of emails from late April 2020 between individuals coordinating investigations related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling a call to coordinate between separate investigations, one of which involves a CBP officer, and mention attorney Donnie Murrell as a person of interest.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.context: Mentioned as an attorney whose contact information is requested because his name came up in a separate investigation related to Epstein.

persons.name: Katrina
persons.context: Referenced as someone available to talk regarding the coordination of investigations.

connections.description: Both are mentioned in the context of coordinating separate investigations related to Epstein, suggesting a professional/legal connection to the case.

events.title: Investigation Coordination Call
events.description: Email chain discusses scheduling a call to coordinate between separate investigations related to Jeffrey Epstein, including one involving a CBP officer.

keyFacts: In April 2020, there were active, separate investigations related to Jeffrey Epstein that required coordination between teams.
A CBP officer was the subject of one of these separate investigations connected to Epstein.
Attorney Donnie Murrell's name came up in a separate case, prompting agents to request his contact information.
The emails emphasize the need to coordinate before contacting counsel related to the Epstein investigations.
